intro: Erucastrum erucoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf rocket, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant features slender, upright stems with small, elongated leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and arranged in clusters, typical of the family. Erucastrum erucoides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sunny, well-drained environments.
